Posts.Content: newbieagain wrote: Hello, I have been checking out some of your posts. What a caring group you are. There are just a handful of people in my life that have shared bc experiences. Almost all my sisters are online. 6 1/2 yrs ago I was dx'd with tubular carcinoma, stage 1, no nodes. No chemo, no rads, but I did chose to have a bilateral mast. Tamoxifen for 3 years, I quit after that, it made my life miserable.  A couple of weeks ago I noticed rib pain...severe. I was down and out for a few days. Onc ordered a bone scan and PET. Both tests showed "trauma" in the 5th rib, same as cancer side. As far as I know there had been no trauma, wouldn't I have felt that? They can't rule out mets. Now my onc wants me to wait 1-2 months for a repeat bone scan. I would like some input here. I have 2 young teenagers who kinda need me right now, and I am not willing to play roulette with my health. Has anyone here had a similar experience? Hugs to all, Pam Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New here newbieagain skirk

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2008 08:06PM newbieagain wrote: Sherri, That is great news. I'm so glad you can relax a little now. I am confused though...you want to be menopausal? I guess if you have gone through all the hot flashes, and the other fun already you might as well be, right? Hope you will celebrate :) Pam
Posts.Title: New here newbieagain skirk

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2008 09:56AM newbieagain wrote: Hey, thanks everybody! I am just going to try to relax and not worry until there is something more to worry about. Easier said than done. In the meantime, my prayers will be with you all here. My heart is touched by your friendships, and pain. Keep fighting that enemy. Hugs, Pam
Posts.Title: New here newbieagain skirk

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 07:35PM newbieagain wrote: Maglebyr, They thought you had shingles?? It seems like sometimes they think a bad diagnosis is better than none. I will turn 50 in a couple of months, and wonder if this has something to do with being forced into early menopause with tamoxifen. My bones aren't what they used to be. Stay with the doctors, don't let up, they don't know it all. Pam
Posts.Title: New here newbieagain skirk

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2008 08:10PM newbieagain wrote: Maglebyr, I didn't know about the side effect of tamox either. Do you think it is true? It would certainly explain why my kids think I have early alzheimers. Seriously, I can't remember anything! Do you know the other day I forgot to turn the car off???? How do you forget that?? Fortunately, my husband was home and found it running in the garage before we croaked. I think that scared us both a little. Before that it was something we joked about, not anymore. Pam
